summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from June-July 2020 regarding a request for assistance with a 'taint review' in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails show FBI agents in New York and another field office (TD) coordinating volunteer help for this high-profile investigation.

persons.name: I. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Appears to be the primary FBI agent in New York requesting and coordinating assistance for a taint review related to the Epstein case. They are the case agent.

persons.name: (TD) (FBI)
persons.context: An FBI agent from another field office (TD) who volunteers to assist with the Epstein case taint review and coordinates logistics.

persons.name: M. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: An FBI agent in New York who is contacted by the case agent (I.) regarding the initial request for taint review assistance.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the high-profile investigation for which the FBI is conducting a taint review.

connections.description: FBI colleagues coordinating work on the Epstein case, with (TD) volunteering to assist I. with a taint review.
FBI colleagues in New York; I. contacts M. to request help finding personnel for the Epstein taint review.

events.title: Initial Request for Taint Review Assistance
events.description: FBI Special Agent I. (NY) emails M. (NY) requesting assistance with a taint review for the Epstein case.

events.title: Formal Request for Taint Review Volunteers
events.description: A formal email is sent to multiple FBI personnel in New York, describing the request for taint review assistance as a 'unique opportunity to work on a high profile investigation' related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled Training and Coordination
events.description: Agent (TD) informs Agent I. that they will be at '26 fed' (likely 26 Federal Plaza, FBI NY Field Office) for training and to coordinate on the taint review.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza (implied FBI New York Field Office)
keyFacts: The FBI was actively seeking assistance for a 'taint review' related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation as of June-July 2020.
The request for help was described internally as a 'unique opportunity to work on a high profile investigation.'
The correspondence shows internal FBI coordination between the New York field office and another field office (TD) for case support.
The document references the creation of a 'CAIR account' for accessing information 'on the high side,' indicating secure systems were involved.
The primary case agent is identified as 'SA I. (NY) (FBI)' from the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad.
